Class description:
Class for powers of variables

1.00
Author:
Ivan Petrovic

Field Detail

VERSION_NUM

public static final java.lang.String VERSION_NUM
Version number of class in form xx.yy where xx is major version/release number and yy is minor release number.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

variable

protected Variable variable
Variable of this power

exponent

protected int exponent
Exponent of power (e.g. (x_2)^7 has exponent 7; (u_5)^3 has exponent 3 etc.); this value theoretically can be any integer, but only objects with positive exponents will be kept in memory

mul

public Power mul(Power p)
Multiplication with another power if two powers are of same variable (same type and index) resulting power will have total exponent equals to the sum of exponents of two multipliers

Parameters:
p - The Power multiplier
Returns:
Current power object after multiplication

addToExponent

public void addToExponent(int exp)
Increments exponent of power; value of argument can be any integer, but special care is taken in caller functions when resulting exponent is not positive

Parameters:
exp - Exponent increment
